history.content:
Does anyone have a template for creating their 4 year plans?

I'm currently a rising Junior and I've already taken 61A/61B/CS70/Math 54. I'm currently enrolled in Math53/Data 100 this summer. All of my electives/other graduating requirements are about completed. I'm planning on taking Korean each semester. 

There are 7 classes left for a DS major / 4 Classes left for CS minor (cs61c and 3 upper divs). However, I'm already taking Data 100 so there are only 6 classes left for DS. And there is a policy (I think) where 1 upper div class can be used to fulfill both a major and minor, so 3 classes left for a CS Minor.

So this means I have a total 9 classes left to take. 

I really want to take CS 184 and CS 160 (both do not fulfil DS major :((, only cs minor) but how likely am I able to get into the class without CS major priority ???....

I was planning on taking the classes that overlap between a DS major and CS major in case down the line I try to reapeal for a CS major (cuz i failed bc im dum...) 

I'm going to declare DS this summer so I can get priority enrollment. However, what if I try to switch majors down the line?? Can I even do that? (I made an apt w an advisor, but the earliest appointment is like in 1-2 weeks)

Could someone help me decide which upper divs to take together and when ? So I don't die from overwork. 

Also if anyone is doing the same path as me, do you mind sharing which classes you took together/4 year plan and your experience or something? I really need some guidance because I feel so lost. 

Would I have time to also minor in Korean .... ? 

Fall 21 

-cs170 (1) [please I hope I get in sighhhhh]

-ee126 (2)

-cs61c (3)

-Korean 10A

Spring 21 

-upper div (4) (i really want to take cs 184)

-upper div (5) (cs 169)

-upper div (6) (cs 160)

-Korean 10B

Summer 21

pray for an internship...

maybe summer classes...

Fall 22

Study abroad 

-upper div(7)

-korean 100A

Spring 22

-upper div(8)

-upper div (9)

-korean 100B
history.subject: Help Creating Two Year Plan DS Major/CS Minor
